I emailed Oleg Vishnepolsky (CTO of Daily Mail) what his best advice for people on LinkedIn was & his response was powerful.
Daily Mail is the world’s largest English newspaper with 225 million reads per month.
Oleg has a reputation for posting fascinating updates & personal stories from work.
So I asked Oleg what the best thing people can do on Linkedin is.
And his response was so great I wanted to share it here:
1. Post interesting stories from your own experience
5. Capture attention in the first line
Sometimes all it takes is a curious email to get an answer.
What else would you add to this list?
Anything we're missing Jeff, Michaela, Manu?
What makes a person "blow up" on LinkedIn?
I'm conducting a seminar this afternoon to first year hospitality students on the value and applications of LinkedIn.

In one exercise they will be examining the profiles of Michaela Alexis, Manu Goswami, Alexandra Galviz and String Nguyen - people who used LinkedIn to ignite their brand which was a game changer in terms of opportunity and career.

I've seen others do this too through consistent content creation, thoughtful commenting and cultivating a LinkedIn tribe - Sarah Elkins, Amy Blaschka, Kerri Twigg, Trent Selbrede, Adam Karpiak, Christine Homolko, thom h. boehm, and Alan Geller (and there are so many more!).
My other point of this post is to demonstrate the impact of tagging people and in what situations you should employ this strategy so my questions to you are:
- What opportunities has LinkedIn unlocked for you?
- What advice do you have for my students who may just be dipping their toe in LinkedIn?
- Who else has blown up LinkedIn? In what way? Feel free to tag them!

Grade A Digital is a social media agency that offers outsourced social media managed services that include social media strategy, social media training, and content/community management for businesses. We don’t just want to manage your presence and hand over a monthly report. We want to become your partner in the fast-paced digital landscape and help you navigate your way to the top.As President, my role is to help develop strategies and support for clients, lead GAD as it quickly grows, and share my experience and knowledge of the power of social media and compelling content.

Grade A is a managed technology support and services provider. In other words, we've got your back when it comes to anything and everything tech related during your work hours. Need a sidekick to help you incorporate technology in your business' long term strategy? No problemo. Printer problems driving you up a wall? We answer all incoming calls within 15 seconds or less. Need to change your desktop wallpaper to a portrait of your cat? We've got you covered for one monthly flat rate per user. It's seriously that simple. At Grade A, I manage everything from Google AdWords to in person events. Since coming on board in March 2016, I've increased Grade A's LinkedIn followers by 1363%, thrown a corporate party for 150 guests (which included my signature branded donut wall), and have helped bring Grade A into the spotlight!
Founder, Social Media & Content Marketing Consultant

Managed a team of Digital Growth Specialists and Digital Workflow Experts in an innovative position that combines customer service, sales, and marketing. Some of my accomplishments include: - 3 sales through social media - 6 week webinar social media bootcamp for small business - Better Coffee Break series - Faces Awards nominations for "Best  Business Social Media Account" and "Social Media Personality" - E-book on productivity hacks - E-book on "How Your Small Business Can Do Social Media Better"

• Trained social media best practices and online reputation management to over 100employees• Simultaneously managed over 64 social media accounts and 4 company blogs, includingan internal communications blog for employees• Increased Google+ reviews from 14 negative to 750+ positive reviews across thecompany.• Managed email campaigns, resident contests, and charity events• Managed Facebook advertisements for promotions and events• Oversaw and managed the social media campaign for new brand launch, which led to a3rd place award for “Biggest Disrupter” at the 2015 Landlord WEBCON and RentalMarketing Awards• Full attendance and training in social media at the National Apartment AssociationAnnual Conference in Denver, Colorado• Increased CLV Group Twitter followers by 729%• Increased CLV Group Facebook fans by 450%• Increased CLV Group Pinterest followers by 157%• Won 3rd place for “Best Use of Social Media” at the 2015 Landlord WEBCON and RentalMarketing Awards

The Ottawa Network for Education (ONFE) facilitates dialogue and action to support public education at all levels in our community. We also help to channel financial resources, in-kind donations and meaningful volunteer contributions to where they can do the most good within our local education system.

The CONNECTOR Program is a dynamic and effective referral process replicated in 12 communities across Canada. The Ottawa CONNECTOR Program (OCP) will address the barriers employment ready immigrants (Connectees) face developing professional networks, by linking them to business and community leaders (Connectors) within Ottawa for Information Meetings and Speed Interviews.

summary: ***BIG NEWS!! My most recent LinkedIn video campaign, #letsgethonest, reached over 26 million users!***When I was in kindergarten, I ran home excitedly one day, brimming with glitter and pride, as I announced that I was "The ONLY TOOTH FAIRY at Career Day, and everybody else in my class was just dressed up as doctors and dentists!"​ My imaginative spirit has not changed much since that day.My name is Michaela and I'm a Marketing Specialist accidentally turned Linkedin Viral Content Creator living in Ottawa, Canada. I had my first viral hit article on Linkedin back in March 2016, and have been writing ever since. I've gone from a few hundred to 85,000+ followers in a year, garnering multiple millions of views, comments, shares, and general love from this community along the way. My articles and advice have since been published on CNBC, Success.com, Shopify, NDC News, Yahoo! Finance, MSN Money, PR Daily, The Muse, Job.com, Thought Catalog, and more! When I'm not writing or brainstorming, I spend my time volunteering with The Boys and Girls Club, ONFE, and teaching Canadian newcomers how to network and maintain confidence during their job search. I love serving others, helping my connections reach their potential, and sprinkling smiles wherever and whenever I can. Oh, and coffee...drinking loads and loads of coffee! WANT TO GET IN TOUCH? 👇For business opportunities, please contact me directly at malexis@gradeadigital.comWant EVEN MORE positivity in your news feed? ✌️Join me on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook!Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/michaeladalexisTwitter: @mickalexis Instagram: @mickalexisLove & coffee, Michaela Regarding speaking engagements for Michaela Alexis please visit Bespoken Bureau at www.bespokenbureau.com or email petar@bespokenbureau.com.
